intro: Hoya commutata, commonly known as the Rosy Wanda, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, waxy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Hoya commutata is a climbing or trailing plant that thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. It is popular among houseplant enthusiasts due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
